primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The restoration of spiritual sight to a blind humanity through the work of Jesus Christ, moving from spiritual death/blindness to worship.

subject.identificatie: Jesus Christ (and the Holy Spirit as the internal agent)
tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ came to do and told us something about who he was
Jesus’ ability to deal with our spiritual blindness
by the Holy Spirit you get spiritual sight

object.identificatie: Spiritual Sight / Perception of Reality / Worship
tekstueel_bewijs: the ultimate healing of spiritual sight... worshiping the right thing

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Gospel of Grace
tekstueel_bewijs: the works of God might be displayed in him
the gospel is that you are a sinner saved by grace

ontvanger.identificatie: The Hearer / Humanity (represented by the blind man)
tekstueel_bewijs: for him to see me mended
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is invited to identify with the Receiver (the beggar/blind man) rather than the Subject.

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / Suffering (as a catalyst)
tekstueel_bewijs: unless trouble has come into your life, it’s pretty tough to come to grips with the gospel
the Holy Spirit opens your eyes
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who acts, not merely a Helper to human effort.

tekstueel_bewijs: the deepest blindness is blindness to your own blindness
it creates tremendous pride and self-righteousness
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Blindness is presented as a total inability to sense reality, requiring a 're-birth' or 'new life,' not just a moral adjustment.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical response of worship and honest self-assessment following the restoration of sight.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Worship is the 'ultimate healing' that follows the initial act of grace; it is the fruit of the primary program.

voorbeelden_god_subject: the Holy Spirit opens your eyes
He has to be torn if we’re going to be mended
voorbeelden_mens_subject: you must have done something to deserve it
you can’t just work on your heart

voorbeelden: I have to worship... No, no, no.
Your heart has to be engaged.
I knew it abstractly... but I didn't see it.
Jesus’ ability to deal with our spiritual blindness
the Holy Spirit enables you to see

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) granted by God to a Subject (Man) who is fundamentally 'Incompetent' (Blind/Dead).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Suffering) through the negation of ~S1 (Moralism) to S1 (Grace) via the 'torn' Christ.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ enters S2 (Darkness/Forsakenness) to move the Receiver to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; sin is described as a total lack of life/sensation.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject of salvation and defines human effort (moralism) as a form of blindness.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The sermon explicitly rejects the 'reap what you sow' model.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of Active Verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He has to be torn if we’re going to be mended.
The deepest blindness is blindness to your own blindness.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The blind man is not a model of virtue to imitate, but a model of a 'beggar' who receives.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God acts on the man; the man responds in worship.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of self-salvation; move toward humility.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic opening of eyes; synergistic response of worship.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the physical miracle to the spiritual reality is seamless and structurally sound.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He has to be plunged into darkness... He did that for you.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit grants the 'Pouvoir-voir' (Power to see).

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is a total sensory deprivation regarding God.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of a grace-oriented actantial structure where God is the Subject and Man is the Receiver.

identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: The Hearer as the Blind Man
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Maintain the 'beggar' status of the hearer.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; it effectively counters the Devoir (Law) of the Pharisees.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Continue emphasizing that 'seeing' is a gift, not a task.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The 'Opponent' (Pride) is well-defined as a terminal condition.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon masterfully avoids the trap of 'exemplarism' by making the blind man's passivity the key to his restoration.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Sound of Music' illustration, Greimas shows that this illustration serves to negate the 'Sender' of Merit.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the pool of Siloam; semiotics explains why the man must be 'Sent' (Receiver) rather than 'Doer' (Subject).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the Pharisees' 'blindness' is actually their insistence on being the 'Subject' of their own salvation.

volledige_subject_lijst: Jesus (saw, said, spit, made, put, heard, found)
The Man (went, washed, came, said, worshiped)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Axis of Power' to show that human 'Pouvoir' is zero until the 'Subject' (Jesus) intervenes.
